sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Welcome to Unit 11 of our English learning journey. In this unit, we'll explore the question structure 'How long have you (been)...?'

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: This form is useful for inquiring about the duration of an action or state. Let's delve into the key concepts.

sections.title: Question Structure
sections.content: 'How long have you been' + present perfect continuous verb form
points: How long have you lived in this city?

sections.title: Usage
sections.content: Inquire about the duration of an ongoing action or state up to the present moment
points: Understand someone's experience or activity over a specific period

sections.title: Examples
sections.content: Let's examine examples to illustrate the application of the 'How long have you (been)...?' structure:
points: How long have you been studying English?
How long have you been working at this company?
How long have you known your best friend?

sections.title: Time Expression
sections.content: Understand the importance of time expressions in answering questions with this structure.

sections.title: Common Mistakes
sections.content: Address common mistakes related to the formation and usage of the 'How long have you (been)...?' structure.
points: Incorrect:How long have you played tennis?
Correct: How long have you been playing tennis?

sections.title: Recap and Summary:
sections.content: In summary, the 'How long have you (been)...?' structure is a powerful tool for inquiring about the duration of ongoing actions or states. Pay attention to the verb form and time expressions for accuracy.

sections.title: Additional Resources:
sections.content: For additional practice and reinforcement, consider exploring examples in language learning books and online exercises

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.content: Thank you for joining today's lesson on the 'How long have you (been)...?' structure. Practice using it to inquire about experiences and durations, and feel free to reach out if you have any questions. Happy learning!
